name: 2-pyridinamine, 3-methyl-
Reason: The target compound is 3-methyl-2-pyridinamine. The basic unit to compare with is pyridine, which has a melting point of around -42°C. The amine group normally increases the melting point due to the potential for intermolecular hydrogen bonding, which can be estimated to have an increase effect of +70°C. The methyl group generally makes the compound more hydrophobic and may slightly lower the melting point, approximately -5°C due to steric hindrance and its electron-donating effect which slightly destabilizes the aromatic ring. The net effect should be a significant increase in melting point due to the amine, with a smaller opposing effect from the methyl group.
